trainings.title: Sustainable Organic Farming Techniques - 3 Week Program

sessions.topic: Introduction to Sustainable Farming & Soil Health

trainings.targetAudience: Farmers seeking sustainable agricultural practices and organic certification

description.brief: Comprehensive three-week training program on sustainable and organic farming techniques for small and medium-scale farmers.
description.full: This intensive training program covers essential sustainable farming practices including organic pest management, soil health improvement, water conservation, and crop rotation strategies. Participants gain hands-on experience through field demonstrations, practical exercises, and real farm visits. The course is designed to help farmers transition to organic methods and potentially achieve organic certification.
objectives: Master principles of sustainable agriculture and organic farming
Implement organic pest control methods without chemical pesticides
Improve soil health through natural composting techniques
Develop water conservation and irrigation strategies
Plan and execute effective crop rotation systems

topics: Introduction to organic methods and certification
Field visit to successful organic farm
Organic pesticide preparation from neem, chili, etc.
Marketing organic produce and certification process

outcomes: Ability to implement sustainable practices on own farm
Reduced dependency on chemical inputs by 70%+
Improved soil health and long-term crop yields
Cost savings of ₹15,000-₹25,000 per acre annually
Preparation for organic certification process

facilitators.name: Mr. Senthil Kumar
facilitators.title: Organic Farming Expert & Certified Trainer
facilitators.bio: 15 years of experience in sustainable agriculture training with 2000+ farmers trained

facilitators.name: Dr. Priya Devi
facilitators.title: Soil Scientist & Agricultural Consultant
facilitators.bio: PhD in Soil Science, specialist in organic farming systems and soil health

requirements.prerequisites: Basic farming experience preferred but not mandatory

certificate.type: Certificate of Completion in Sustainable Organic Farming
certificate.criteria: Attend all 3 sessions (minimum 90% attendance) and complete practical assignments

logistics.materials: All training materials, workbooks, and digital resources provided

trainings.title: Traditional Seed Preservation & Seed Bank Management
trainings.targetAudience: Farmers, homemakers, and seed savers interested in preserving indigenous crop varieties

description.brief: One-day intensive training on traditional seed preservation methods, seed bank setup, and maintaining indigenous crop diversity.
description.full: Learn the art and science of preserving indigenous seeds through this comprehensive hands-on training. Participants will master traditional and modern seed storage techniques, understand seed viability testing, and learn to establish community seed banks. This training emphasizes the critical importance of maintaining genetic diversity in crops for food security and climate resilience.
objectives: Understand importance of seed preservation for food security and biodiversity
Master traditional seed cleaning, drying, and storage techniques
Learn to identify high-quality seeds and test viability
Set up home or community seed banks
Document and catalog indigenous seed varieties

topics: Introduction to seed sovereignty and biodiversity
Traditional vs modern seed preservation methods
Hands-on seed cleaning and drying techniques
Seed storage containers and environmental control
Seed exchange networks and legal aspects

outcomes: Ability to preserve seeds for 2-5 years with high viability
Knowledge of 20+ indigenous crop varieties suitable for region
Skills to run home or community seed bank
Understanding of seed laws and farmers' rights
Network with other seed savers in Tamil Nadu

facilitators.name: Mrs. Lakshmi Raman
facilitators.title: Traditional Seed Keeper & Community Organizer
facilitators.bio: 30+ years maintaining indigenous seed varieties, trained 500+ farmers in seed preservation

requirements.prerequisites: Interest in seed preservation, gardening, or farming
whatToBring: Seeds from home garden (optional for practice)

logistics.materials: Seed preservation starter kit worth ₹300 provided to all participants

trainings.title: Natural Water Harvesting & Farm Pond Construction
trainings.targetAudience: Small and medium farmers facing water scarcity issues

description.brief: Two-day practical training on designing and constructing farm ponds, check dams, and rainwater harvesting structures.
description.full: This hands-on training addresses critical water scarcity challenges faced by farmers. Participants learn to design site-specific water harvesting structures, calculate water storage capacity, construct farm ponds using low-cost techniques, and implement rainwater harvesting systems. Day 1 covers theory and design, Day 2 is full practical construction demonstration at a real farm site.
objectives: Design cost-effective farm ponds suitable for land size and rainfall
Calculate water storage requirements for crops and livestock
Construct check dams and contour bunds
Implement rooftop and surface rainwater harvesting
Understand government subsidies and schemes for water harvesting

topics: Water crisis in agriculture - current scenario
Farm pond design considerations (size, depth, location)
Soil type and water retention capacity
Survey and marking of pond location

outcomes: Ability to design farm pond for own land
Knowledge to construct 20,000-50,000 liter capacity pond
Water security for at least 2-3 dry months
Potential water cost savings of ₹20,000-₹40,000 annually
Access to government subsidy programs (up to 60% cost)

facilitators.name: Mr. Vijay Kumar
facilitators.title: Water Conservation Engineer
facilitators.bio: 12 years designing water harvesting structures for 300+ farms across Tamil Nadu

facilitators.name: Mr. Murugan Natarajan
facilitators.title: Experienced Farmer & Water Harvesting Practitioner
facilitators.bio: Successfully implemented 5 farm ponds, saved ₹50,000 annually on water

requirements.prerequisites: Must own or lease farmland (minimum 1 acre)
whatToBring: Farm details (size, soil type, crop pattern)

logistics.materials: Design workbook, calculation sheets, subsidy application templates

trainings.title: Vermicomposting & Organic Manure Production
trainings.targetAudience: Farmers, home gardeners, and entrepreneurs interested in organic fertilizer production

description.brief: Learn to set up profitable vermicomposting units for organic fertilizer production and supplementary income.
description.full: This practical training teaches participants to establish and manage vermicomposting units for both personal use and commercial production. Learn about earthworm biology, composting techniques, harvesting methods, and business opportunities. Participants receive earthworm starter culture and setup guidelines. Ideal for farmers wanting to reduce fertilizer costs or create additional income stream through vermicompost sales.
objectives: Understand vermicomposting science and earthworm biology
Set up 6x3 feet vermicompost bed at home/farm
Manage moisture, temperature, and feeding schedules
Harvest and package vermicompost for use or sale
Calculate costs and potential income from vermicomposting

topics: Introduction to vermicomposting and its benefits
Setting up vermicompost beds (size, location, materials)

outcomes: Functional vermicompost unit at home within 2 weeks
Production of 50-100 kg organic fertilizer monthly
Savings of ₹500-₹1000 on fertilizer costs monthly
Potential additional income of ₹3000-₹5000 per month
Waste management solution for kitchen and farm waste

facilitators.name: Mr. Ramesh Babu
facilitators.title: Vermicomposting Specialist
facilitators.bio: 10 years running successful commercial vermicomposting unit, trained 200+ farmers

requirements.prerequisites: Interest in composting or organic farming

logistics.materials: Earthworm starter culture (500g), setup manual, ongoing support

trainings.title: Indigenous Tree Identification & Propagation
trainings.targetAudience: Nature enthusiasts, students, teachers, and conservationists

description.brief: Two-week training on identifying 30+ indigenous tree species and learning propagation techniques for conservation.
description.full: Master the skills of tree identification and propagation through this unique training program. Session 1 focuses on identifying indigenous trees using botanical keys, leaf morphology, and habitat. Session 2 teaches practical propagation methods including seed collection, treatment, germination, and vegetative propagation. Participants receive seed collection kit and propagation materials.
objectives: Identify 30+ indigenous tree species native to Tamil Nadu
Use botanical identification keys and field guides
Collect and process tree seeds properly
Practice seed germination and vegetative propagation
Understand conservation importance of native trees

topics: Introduction to indigenous trees of Tamil Nadu
Guided nature walk in botanical garden

outcomes: Ability to identify common indigenous trees in the region
Skills to propagate trees from seeds and cuttings
Knowledge to establish small home nursery
Understanding of tree conservation needs
Network with conservation community

facilitators.name: Dr. Rajesh Kumar
facilitators.title: Botanist & Environmental Scientist
facilitators.bio: 20+ years researching indigenous trees and conducting conservation programs

requirements.prerequisites: Interest in trees, nature, and conservation
whatToBring: Notebook and colored pencils for sketching

certificate.criteria: Attend both sessions and pass identification test

logistics.materials: Tree identification guide, seed collection kit, propagation tools

trainings.title: Kitchen Gardening & Urban Farming for Beginners
trainings.targetAudience: Apartment residents and homemakers interested in growing vegetables at home

description.brief: Practical workshop on starting a kitchen garden in small spaces - balconies, terraces, and small yards.
description.full: Perfect for urban residents with limited space! Learn to grow fresh vegetables, herbs, and greens at home using containers, grow bags, and vertical gardening techniques. This beginner-friendly workshop covers plant selection for limited space, soil preparation, watering schedules, pest management, and harvesting. Each participant receives starter seeds and a planting guide.
objectives: Set up productive kitchen garden in limited space
Grow 10-15 common vegetables and herbs
Practice organic pest control for home gardens
Harvest fresh vegetables year-round
Reduce monthly vegetable expenses by 30-40%

topics: Plant selection for beginners (tomato, chili, coriander, mint, etc.)
Seed vs seedling - when to use which
Natural pest control for home gardens

outcomes: Functional kitchen garden setup within 1 week
Fresh vegetables and herbs available in 30-45 days
Monthly savings of ₹500-₹1000 on vegetables
Chemical-free homegrown produce
Rewarding hobby and stress relief

facilitators.name: Mrs. Kavitha Menon
facilitators.title: Urban Gardening Expert
facilitators.bio: 8 years helping urban families start kitchen gardens, trained 1000+ apartment dwellers

logistics.materials: Seed packets (10 varieties), planting calendar, ongoing WhatsApp support group

trainings.title: Bee Keeping & Honey Production - Complete Course
trainings.targetAudience: Farmers and entrepreneurs interested in beekeeping as livelihood or supplementary income

description.brief: Comprehensive 3-week beekeeping training covering setup, management, harvesting, and marketing for profitable honey production.
description.full: Transform beekeeping into a profitable venture through this intensive practical training. Learn every aspect from apiary setup to honey marketing. The course includes hands-on practice with live bee colonies, harvesting demonstrations, and business planning. Graduates receive 2 bee boxes, protective equipment, and ongoing mentorship. Average ROI within 8-10 months with proper management.
objectives: Set up and manage apiary with 5-10 bee colonies
Understand bee biology, behavior, and colony dynamics
Prevent and treat common bee diseases
Harvest honey using modern equipment
Process, package, and market honey products
Generate ₹50,000-₹100,000 annual income from 10 boxes

topics: Safety and first aid for bee stings

outcomes: Fully functional apiary with 2 colonies (provided)
Production of 20-30 kg honey per box annually
Income potential: ₹50,000-₹100,000 from 10 boxes
Low maintenance business (2-3 hours weekly)
Contribution to agriculture through pollination
Access to bee keeping network and marketing channels

facilitators.name: Mr. Selvam Pandian
facilitators.title: Professional Bee Keeper & Trainer
facilitators.bio: 15 years commercial beekeeping, managing 100+ colonies, trained 300+ bee keepers

requirements.prerequisites: Space for apiary (backyard, farmland), no allergies to bee stings
whatToBring: Full-sleeve shirt and long pants (light colored)

certificate.criteria: Attend all 3 sessions, pass practical assessment

logistics.materials: 2 bee boxes with colonies, protective suit, smoker, harvesting tools, ongoing mentorship
